title: Migrate eth-json-rpc-provider libraries into core monorepo
body:
As part of Shared Libraries Q3 OKRs, the team would like to migrate `eth-json-rpc-provider` libraries into this monorepo to make it easier to maintain.

See [#1079 comment](https://github.com/MetaMask/core/issues/1079#issuecomment-1700126302) for instructions on accomplishing this.

## Migration Checklist

### Epic A: Preparation in source repo

#### 1. Align TypeScript, ESLint, Prettier dependency versions and configurations with the core monorepo.
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/eth-json-rpc-provider/pull/28
  - [x] If migration target is ahead of core in dependency versions, consider updating core dependencies first.
  - [x] Resolve all resulting issues.
#### 2. Add any missing files required in subpackages of the core monorepo (e.g. LICENSE).
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/eth-json-rpc-provider/pull/24
#### 3. Create a new release of the migration target from the source repo
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/eth-json-rpc-provider/pull/29
- All subsequent releases of migration target will be partial releases made from the core monorepo.
#### 4. Add migration notice to README
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/eth-json-rpc-provider/pull/38

* * *

### Epic B: Staging from `merged-packages/`
#### 0. Move the migration target into a temporary directory in core (`merged-packages/`).
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1755
  - [x] Follow these instructions to ensure that the original git history remains fully intact after the transfer: https://github.com/MetaMask/core/issues/1079#issuecomment-1700126302.
  - [x] MUST NOT rebase the `migrate-<package-name>` branch. 
  - [ ] Ensure that superfluous merge commits don't pollute the history. If necessary, replace the PR branch with a cleaned-up post-migration commit history by rerunning the git history migration steps before merging the PR.
    - For context: https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1804#issuecomment-1771445829
  - [x] Contact admins to temporarily enable merge commits into main.
  - [x] Merge PR **without squashing** to preserve the migrated git commit history.

#### 1. Remove files and directories that will be replaced by files in the monorepo root.
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1764
  - [x] **Remove**: `.github/`, `.git*`, `scripts/`, `.depcheckrc.json`, `.yarn/`, `.yarnrc.yml`, `yarn.lock`, `.editorconfig`, `.eslint*`, `.prettier*`, `.nvm*`.
  - [x] **Keep**: `src/`, `tests/`, `CHANGELOG.md`, `LICENSE`, `package.json`, `README.md`, `jest.config.js`, `tsconfig*.json`, `typedoc.json`. 
  
#### 2. Replace config files.
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1765
  - [x] Update `tsconfig*.json`, `typedoc.json`, `jest.config.js` to extend from corresponding files in root. Copy contents of corresponding files in other non-root packages.
  - [x] Keep TypeScript compiler flags. 
  - [x] Add tsconfig reference paths for non-root packages that are upstream dependencies of the migration target.
  - [x] Keep Jest coverage threshold values. 
  - [x] Add `deepmerge` as a devDependency.
  
#### 3. Align dependencies with monorepo.
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1766
  - [x] Remove redundant dependencies that are already listed in the root package.json.
  - [x] Bump remaining dependency versions so that they align with other non-root packages.
  
#### 4. Add exception for non-MIT license.
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1767
  - [x] If migration target uses a non-MIT license, add exception entries in the root `constraints.pro` file.  
  - [x] Make sure the new rule doesn't break any of the existing package.json files by running `yarn constraints`.

#### 5. Update README
- [x] Update contents of migration target's README to reflect new status as a non-root package in the monorepo.

#### 6. Port tags 
- [x] See: https://github.com/MetaMask/core/issues/1800
  - [x] Port the tags locally with the correct package name prefixes.
  - [x] Push the ported tags to a testing fork of the core monorepo.
  - [x] Verify that the tag diff links in CHANGELOG are working.
  - [x] The diff between last tag before migration and first one after will always include the entire history of the monorepo.
      - TODO: The correct diff can be derived using `git log --ancestry-path`. If GitHub starts supporting compare links that use `--ancestry-path`, the broken diff link in the changelog should be fixed.
  - [x] Push the ported tags to the core repo.
  - [x] Verify that the tag diff links in CHANGELOG are working.

* * *

### Epic C: Integration into `packages/`
- [x] https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1738

#### 1. The big leap
- [x] **Move migration target from `merged-packages/` to `packages/`.**
- [x] Run `yarn install` in the root directory.
- [x] Check that all tests are passing in migration target by running `yarn workspace @metamask/<package-name> test`.

#### 2. Update downstream repos
- [x] Add tsconfig reference paths for migration target in downstream packages and root.
- [x] Bump migration target version in downstream packages and root.
  - Notes on why this version bump needs to happen as part of this PR (import module shadowing): https://github.com/MetaMask/core/pull/1738#discussion_r1357554901

#### 3. Linter fixes
- [x] Apply yarn constraints fixes to migration target package.json file: `yarn constraints --fix` (run twice).
- [x] Identify validator fixes for CHANGELOG using `yarn workspace @metamask/<package-name> changelog:validate` and apply the diffs. 

#### 4. Resolve or TODO downstream errors
- If introducing the migration target breaks any downstream repos:
  - [x] Resolve simple errors
  - [x] Mark and ignore complex/blocked errors using `@ts-expect-error TODO:` annotations. 
- [x] Create a separate issue for resolving the marked errors as soon as the migration is completed.
  - https://github.com/MetaMask/core/issues/1823

#### 5. Finalize merge
- [x] Check that all tests are passing in all subpackages of core and CI.
- [x] Merge `packages/<package-name>` directory into core main branch.

* * *

### Epic D: Final steps

### Source repo

- [ ] Transfer branches/issues/PRs from the source repo into the core monorepo.
  - [ ] Blocked by #1835 
- [ ] Leave a note in the source repo's README announcing the migration and pointing to core.
- [ ] Sunset GitHub Pages docs and leave link pointing to migrated docs in core.
- [ ] Archive the source repo to prevent any changes from being pushed to it going forward.

### Core

- [x] Add migration target to README dependency graph using the `generate-dependency-graph` build script.
- [x] Record any changes made to monorepo packages during the migration process in their respective CHANGELOGs.
- [x] List the migrated package as an **ADDED** change in the root CHANGELOG.
- [ ] Fix downstream errors that were marked with `@ts-expect-error TODO:` during the migration process.
